text: Sharp County is a county in the U.S. state of Arkansas. As of the 2020 census, the population was 17,271. The county seat is Ash Flat. The county was created on July 18, 1868, and named for Ephraim Sharp, a state legislator from the area. == References == Category:1860s establishments in Arkansas Category:1868 establishments in the United States Category:Arkansas counties
title: Sharp County, Arkansas
